title: What's the difference between 'scientifically correct' and 'technically correct'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Scientifically correct is used when an event or a situation is following the rules of conduct of a scientific discovery like the Laws of Motion. Technically correct is more of a Logical term. For an example take two people A and B running a lap race.A wins the race. Technically, ‘A’ could be called the faster of the two, but if upon taking the average deviation of the lap times reveals that ‘B’ has lesser deviation, he would be faster Scientifically[Or Mathematically].Technically, the Earth is round but Scientifically, it is spherical.Technically, a neutron has no charges but Scientifically, it’s charges undo each other.Technically, we can speak but Scientifically we are just vibrating our throat muscles at a certain frequency.
Scientifically correct means the observed fact and technically correct means what is logically correct.
